sequence: It ’ s Scorsese ’ s 10th DGA nomination and first for a documentary . He received his eighth feature film nomination for The Wolf of Wall Street and was nominated in 1998 for Best Documentary for The Blues . His first four feature film nominations came for Mean Streets ( 1974 ) , Taxi Driver ( 1975 ) , Raging Bull and Goodfellas (both 1990) . Scorsese was also nominated for The Aviator in 2004. DGA Documentary Nomination: The Last Waltz 1979 (winner). DGA TV Nomination: Episode 101, “Pilot” 2014 for Boardwalk Empire.

WINNIPEG — Turning trash into treasure is somewhat of an art form , but the new season of a HGTV show hopes to help people find the fun in furniture flipping. The fourth season of Love It Or List It Vancouver premieres Monday, featuring a familiar face in the Winnipeg real-estate community. “Love It Or List It Vancouver” host Todd Talbot. Todd Talbot is back on TV, this time on the flip side of the coin as one of the hosts of the HGTV show. “As a self-proclaimed serial renovator, I’ve been flipping houses since 1994,” he told the CBC in a recent interview.

Australia 's Cordell Jigsaw Zapruder has got a toe-hold on New Zealand 's reality TV , buying Greenstone TV for $28 million. Greenstone is a 50% joint venture between Australia's Nine Network and NZ On Air. Greenstone manages the NZ$16.25 million a year of public money that goes towards Kiwi drama and comedy, and buys most of New Zealand's home-made dramas for air on Nine-owned network TV One. Nine will pay $24.5 million, or $28 million Aussie dollars, to Greenstone owner the NZCU Employees Superannuation Scheme and the NZCU Shareholder Trust.

A FAKE doctor allegedly used useless metal rods to test people for cancer and diabetes then charged a fortune to fix the problem, a coroner has heard. Teresa Nguyen allegedly used the same equipment for several patients in the Brisbane area over a six-month period. The Brisbane District Court was told that one woman paid $2200 to have metal rods implanted into her arm, only to be told she was not a genuine candidate for the procedure. Nguyen had also allegedly told a woman she had breast cancer, but it turned out she did not have the disease.

To most NBA experts, players and fans, Kobe Bryant is one of the top 20 best players of all time and one of the top five guards the league has ever produced. To some, he is second only to Michael Jordan and to a third, out there, group he is the best of all time. To get the first group of people to consider agreeing with the second (I leave out the third because nobody seriously believes that is ever possible), Kobe Bryant has to lead the Los Angeles Lakers to a championship this season.

MILLERSBURG -- If laughter really is the best medicine , then the people who turned out for the inaugural Standup for Kids benefit comedy night on Saturday at the Millersburg Fire Hall have been given an amazing cure. "I think it went really well , I really do," said event co-chairwoman Katie Miller. The event, which featured three comedians and raised money for Millersburg's newly formed Standup for Kids chapter, brought in approximately 150 attendees. Miller said they were hoping for 50 people, so the event's success took her and her co-chairwoman, Lori Esh, completely by surprise.

The right sheet set and pajamas can help you stay cool. Today’s memory-foam mattresses don't sleep as "hot" as older models did, thanks to air-circulating layers and ventilated toppers that keep the foam from absorbing and retaining all your body heat. But a certain insulating effect is unavoidable when you're sleeping on a foam block. If your memory foam mattress leaves you sweating at night, a few remedies can help turn down the heat -- if only by a few degrees. Anything you can do to distance your body from the memory foam will help keep you cool.

The Toronto real estate market is showing signs of stirring from its deep freeze, with new listings starting to pick up — and an almost 8 per cent spike in prices — as of mid February, year over year, according to figures released Wednesday. Some 2,767 properties were sold during the first two weeks of February, up just 1.3 per cent from the same period a year ago, says the Toronto Real Estate Board. But the average sale price was up 7.8 per cent to $547,107 from the $507,474 recorded in the first two weeks of February 2013.

Todd P, one of the city's top local independent music promoters, helped open up a new venue last night in Bushwick/East Williamsburg, aka East Williamsburg Industrial Park. It's called Danbro Studios Warehouse, and it's home is in a mid-1800s raw warehouse, previously home to the Goldenrod Brewery, a 1930's-era beer manufacturer long shuddered, a victim of prohibition. The venue's first show featured popular Minneapolis punk rock band Dillinger 4 (bio) as they celebrated the release of Civil War, their first LP since 2002's Situationist Comedy.

Many Alberta small-business owners, who have been struggling through a prolonged economic downturn, are hoping the next provincial government will bring relief through business-friendly policies. The Alberta election is April 16 and polls suggest that Rachel Notley’s ruling New Democrats will be replaced with Jason Kenney’s United Conservatives, which have campaigned to scrap the carbon tax and loosen some labour rules that have driven up business costs. Over the past two years, small-business confidence in Alberta has reached the lowest levels ever recorded in the country, according to the Canadian Federation of Independent Business, which has been tracking the measure for about 20 years.

The Jawbone Up debuted last year with big ambitions: A bracelet-like device that you'd wear all the time, tracking how much you move and how well you sleep. Paired with an app, the Up helps you recognize patterns in your habits, empowering you to improve your health. One problem: It wasn't built to withstand the punishment of being a wearable device. Unlike a cellphone that resides in your pocket or a bag, the Up wraps around your wrist, exposed to the world just as much as your skin is. Many users found it quickly malfunctioned, and Jawbone recalled the Up and issued refunds.

Perhaps the most ironic and scary part of the whole “ Thank You ” rally was the crowd ’ s reaction when Obama told the crowd he wanted them to “ go out and register more people to vote .”
The crowd responded by giving him a standing ovation. But this is exactly how Obama has gotten elected and re elected . His “ grass root ” organization is a fraud . Everybody in the crowd was paid and given free transportation and free housing and free food for the whole two weeks of the campaign . In some cases they were given as much as two thousand dollars in spending money .

LITCHFIELD , Maine ( AP ) — A Maine woman is trying to protect a series of osprey nests atop cell phone towers with a device that mimics the sound of an osprey chick. The Bangor Daily News reports 23-year-old Samantha Wood of Litchfield says the chick distress calls are working because the ospreys have returned each year to the same nests, which are protected from predators by an enclosure. She says she began the project in 2012, when cell phone company Verizon asked her to find a way to protect some ospreys from their nests being destroyed.

Technology offers new and exciting ways for your children to learn and for you to increase your involvement in your children’s education. Children given technology opportunities at home watch less television, improve problem solving and critical thinking skills and excel in written communication skills, math skills and computer skills according to the Department of Education. Parents have found that new technology in schools increases communication with their children and their children’s teachers. Be sure that as a parent, you stay up to date on the evolution of technology in education so that your kids can reap the benefits.

What Steve Lonegan can teach Republicans about making life hell for Democrats . New Jersey Senate candidate Steve Lonegan may not be a name you know yet, but he could be the man to take down New Jersey Democratic Sen. Bob Menendez. A longtime New Jersey resident and political operative, Lonegan has been a top Republican fundraiser, campaigner and consultant for the past two decades. His political work includes stints as the executive director of the New Jersey chapter of the American Conservative Union, as the New Jersey political director for the Republican National Committee and in various consulting and fundraising positions for prominent Republican candidates.

Last week, we learned that the Obama administration is considering other alternatives to stop foreclosures. Today, we have some color on what one of these efforts might look like. It would encourage servicers to reduce struggling borrowers' mortgage balance. Although banks have fought such efforts in the past, it seems that the program could benefit everyone involved. And the best part: it wouldn't take any taxpayer dollars. Of the residential mortgage-backed securities outstanding, about $1.3 trillion are so-called private label notes that were issued by banks and other financial institutions, according to data from the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association.

After delivering a blockbuster such as Meri Gurriya , writer Radain Shah is on a roll as her story explores many different aspects of love. It begins with a flashback which shows the protagonists to be in a train. A girl is singing in the compartment where two boys are present too. She is singing about how love can change the whole world and how she can’t wait for the day when her dreams will turn true. When she completes the song, both the boys appreciate the song but the boys start teasing each other in the same tone as if the singer is a stranger to them.

GoldMoney founder James Turk interviews When Money Dies author Adam Fergusson , who discusses the parallels and differences between the 1920s and today. Fergusson explains how German inflation worked, and how it was caused by an increase in the money supply and a shortage of goods. He notes how the Reichsbank printed money to pay its debts to the US and to keep its own costs low, while consumers were driven to buy whatever they could before prices increased further, causing demand to boom. The situation today is much the same says Fergusson, with governments printing money to buy their way out of economic trouble.

The J. C. Penney Company, the fourth-largest United States retailer, said today that September sales at stores open at least a year were falling short of expectations, prompting several analysts to cut fiscal third-quarter earnings estimates. Warm weather and consumer concerns about the decline in United States stock markets hurt sales of clothes, notebooks and other back-to- school products, retailer analysts said. J. C. Penney's same-store sales may decline as much as 5 percent this month, they said. The company's goal was to increase sales as much as 4 percent.

- Are these the phones Samsung plans to announce? We're two days into 2018 and already the new year is treating us well. Samsung is expected to launch the Galaxy S9 and S9+ in early 2018, so, of course, the leaks are coming full force, starting with renders from this morning, and, now, the first hands-on image of the two handsets. The leak (below), spotted by Androidandme, was shared to the Chinese site Weibo, and it shows the backside of the Galaxy S9 and S9+. Although it looks legit, nothing has been confirmed by Samsung.

A shopping bonanza has hit Bawadi Mall , and will continue until May 1 , as part of Retail Abu Dhabi’s Mother of All Sales campaign. The campaign, running until May 12 , will provide shoppers with massive discounts at the capital’s top malls and outlets. Among the outlets participating at the Bawadi Mall bonanza is The Entertainer, which offers a 30 per cent voucher book worth Dh2,000, in addition to a 25 per cent voucher book, worth Dh1,200, at Spotlight, and 20 per cent discounts at H&M, Vero Moda and Zara for the duration of this campaign.

The Patriot Post® · We Need Fallacy Control Now ! Enough is enough . It ’ s epidemic . It ’ s dangerous . It ’ s a serious threat to our national sovereignty, to our constitutional republic, to our free markets, to our economy, to our security . And we need it to stop . It ’ s not an epidemic of measles , mumps, or the flu. It ’ s an epidemic of lies. An epidemic of deception. An epidemic of fallacies . And fallacies are lies that are not intended to be taken seriously .

A group of Solomon Islands timber exporters and government officials is visiting Australia and New Zealand this week . The delegation is made up of Solomon Islands Trade, Commerce and Industry Ministry officials and members of the SI Forestry Association and is keen to explore ways to export timber products to Australia. The Solomon Islands exported 11,800 cubic metres of logs, sawn timber, veneer and flooring to Australia last year. But the trade was valued at just $10.5 million, or 12.8 percent of total Australian wood imports. The Solomon Islands exported a further 11,840 cubic metres of logs to New Zealand last year.

The ease of Manchester United’s win over Premier League title rivals Chelsea masked a potential moment of controversy after an “innovative” corner routine involving Wayne Rooney, Ryan Giggs and Cristiano Ronaldo produced a goal, with the scores still level, that was disallowed under instruction from the linesman. Step Two: Ryan Giggs picks up the loose ball following Rooney's hand-over. United manager Sir Alex Ferguson expressed astonishment that the effort, converted by Ronaldo, did not stand, admitting the routine had been planned on the training ground. Step one: Wayne Rooney goes over to corner flag to take quick set-piece.

This isn't just a museum; in 2005, the Knesset (Israel's parliament) passed a law declaring Beit Hatfutsot the center for Jewish communities in Israel and around the world. This beautiful facility traces the history of the Jewish people and spotlights the constant evolution of the faith and culture worldwide. Exhibits include artifacts, dioramas and murals. Recent Jewish visitors especially liked tracing their own origins right there at the museum, while non-Jewish visitors found the exhibits educational and engaging. Beit Hatfutsot is located on the Tel Aviv University campus about 5 miles north of the downtown area.

An extra $190,000 in state special education reimbursement funding that came in late last month has helped the town pay off its nearly half million-dollar settlement with the district's bus drivers union, officials said this week. Together with around $300,000 in savings found in the district's fiscal 2011 budget, the money has covered the town's $497,000 obligation to the drivers, whose jobs have been outsourced to a private busing company. The additional special education money, part of the state's circuit breaker program, will prevent the town from having to carry the debt over into fiscal 2012, officials said.

If you would like to support the Down Syndrome Association of West Michigan's campaign of kindness, you may visit the organization's crowd funding site to help pay for supplies. The more money raised, the more random acts of kindness those in our community with Down syndrome will be able to commit. The Down Syndrome Association of West Michigan is a resource and advocacy organization promoting public awareness and supporting lifelong opportunities for individuals with Down syndrome and their families. Down syndrome is the most commonly occurring chromosomal condition, with one in every 700 babies being born with Down syndrome.

On April 22, 2014, Hollingsworth was supposed to drop off 20-month-old Aurora Aryana Hollingsworth at a child-care center about 7:30 a.m. But he “forgot her in the car,” according to an arrest warrant affidavit filed by a North Richland Hills police investigator. “This is a disabled veteran who had several things on his mind that day and just forgot,” Lex Johnston of Hurst, Hollingsworth’s attorney, said Tuesday. Johnston said Hollingsworth’s daughter and four children were living with him, and he took the daughter to work, paid for child care and drove the grandchildren to day care or school.

The Australian telecommunications ( telco ) industry is largely responsible for the highly connected and digital world we live in today. Without telecommunication operators, who would be able to call and message their friends and family across the country? Telecommunications (or ‘telco’) networks connect people across the country. Telcos own and operate the telecommunications equipment (such as mobile phone towers), which transmit voice, data, video, and internet signals from one device to another. Most telcos also supply and maintain the devices we use to connect.

German scientists working on the Wendelstein 7-X fusion device started a series of experiments that could eventually prove the superiority of the stellarator-type fusion devices. German chancellor Angela Merkel prepares to press the start bottom next to the head of the Max Planck Institute for Plasma Physics Sibylle Guenter , left, and Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania governor, Erwin Sellering, right at the Wendelstein 7-X' nuclear fusion research center at the Max-Planck-Institut for Plasma Physics in Greifswald, Germany Wednesday Feb. 3, 2016. Nuclear fusion power has been the dream of many since the 1950s and on Wednesday German scientists took one step closer to making it possible.

9 Nov 2018, 2:47 a.m.
Riders can rent a Spin electric scooter for $1 plus 15 cents per minute, making it an affordable option for short trips. As part of Ford, Spin plans to 'expand aggressively,' giving more people the opportunity to try its service. To start out, Spin is launching today in Detroit. Ford is beefing up its first and last mile transportation offerings. On Thursday, the automaker announced it has acquired electric scooter startup Spin. Founded in San Francisco in 2016, the dockless scooter sharing company currently operates in 13 cities and campuses throughout the US.

Can You Keep a Secret ? is based on Sophie Kinsella ’ s 4-million-copy New York Times bestseller and centers on a high-strung New York attorney, Emma Corrigan (Lively), who is smack-talked by her boss. She gets drunk, and blurts out some not-so-nice statements about everyone at the office party, and she accidentally e mails the confidential list of people she named, to all the people she named. This is not a comedy. There is no laughter. It is just a painful look at one person’s life, told by herself.

Clinton said this week paid family leave is possible by taxing the wealthy but states have done so without soaking the rich. In her opening statement at the first Democratic debate Tuesday, Hillary Clinton mentioned the need for paid family leave, and when asked about it later, she said it was possible to pay for it by having the wealthy foot the bill. The line may be good fodder for Democrats, but looking at how states have done it, as well as current national proposals, show other ways to pay for the policy without soaking the rich.

The ease of Manchester United ’ s win over Premier League title rivals Chelsea masked a potential moment of controversy. Losing 2-0 against the Blues is one thing – conceding the two goals in such questionable circumstances is a different kettle of fish entirely. The Red Devils were beaten at Stamford Bridge on Saturday, courtesy of a Willian goal that was clearly offside before a Marcos Alonso free-kick was allowed to stand. Both the assistant and the on-pitch VAR official had no hesitation in awarding the goals in a match that was always going to be difficult to win.

Banking giant Standard Chartered on Tuesday announced a return of dividends for shareholders after a two-year hiatus as it reported strong results for the six months through June. The Hong Kong-based banking giant, which operates in 60 markets, said it would be returning $1.1 billion, or 15 pence per ordinary share, in the form of a special dividend. The announcement came as the banking group said its half-year profits rose to $4.5 billion, up 22 per cent from a year ago, and that it would be continuing to expand in the United Kingdom, Singapore and Bangladesh and China.

Sunni Fighters Returning To Al-Qaida In Iraq , 'NYT ' Reports : The Two-Way After months of being squeezed out of Iraq, Sunni fighters have found an ally in al-Qaida. The Times reports that many are joining the extremist group to help fight a common enemy, the Shiites who dominate government. The fight against insurgent groups such as Al-Qaeda in Iraq has taken a new turn, The New York Times reported in a story published Tuesday. The Times writes that Sunni insurgents, who fought American troops, are returning to their old ways by joining the jihadi group, according to Iraqis, American intelligence analysts and U.S. officials.

School opened this week , so I thought this exploration would be appropriate and valuable . Recently , I was asked to be the keynote speaker for the school district I teach in . What an honor and responsibility .The question posed to me was “What would you have liked to learn in high school?” This was not an easy task. I have been a teacher for 28 years, and have given many presentations, but this request was different. I thought about what was important to me , and how much more effective I could have been if certain things were different for me.

LOS ANGELES ( AP ) — The Oscars are adding a new category to honor popular films and promising a brisk three-hour ceremony in 2019 to better accommodate the modern-day audience. “We are excited about these steps forward,” Oscar-winning “A Star Is Born” actress and Grammy nominated singer Lady Gaga wrote on Twitter . “We believe we can make this an even better show for the film industry and the global audience that enjoys and relies on the movies,” she said. Oscar organizers have been under pressure to make the telecast more attractive to viewers as the popularity of the awards show has dwindled in recent years.

Golden Livingcenters - Lima is located at the address 599 S Shawnee St in Lima, Ohio 45804. They can be contacted via phone at (419) 227-2154 or via fax at (419) 224-4177 for pricing, hours and directions. Golden Livingcenters - Lima specializes in Whiplash, Aches & Pains, Fractures. Golden Livingcenter - Lima is an average sized, for profit, nursing home with 88 beds based in Lima, OH. At last check, the facility had 87 residents indicating that it is 99% occupied which is more than average within the state of Ohio.

He ’ s eaten dog food and appeared nearly naked on telly , but comedian Alex Horne has revealed his most humiliating moment yet. In this extract from his autobiography, he explains why he thinks it’s best not to get married in your twenties…
Alex Horne and his fiancée Sarah-Jane Dale are planning their wedding and they have a big decision to make. Do they follow the usual route and have a full-scale wedding with bridesmaids and a catering bill? Or do they go for a more unusual celebration? We decide that we’ll do a weekend of events.

When Pacers coach Frank Vogel announced he would sit all five starters for last night's game against the Bucks, it was like a thought experiment come to life. Can a good team's second unit beat the starters of a historically awful team? It was close, but...yes! The game was an exciting one, if only from a theoretical standpoint: You desperately wanted to see what would happen, but not necessarily actually watch it go down. Because this wasn't Copeland and Solomon Hill and C.J. Watson getting meaningful minutes in just any late-season game—this game mattered.

In the age of Instagram , food is no longer designed to just be food . It ’ s a showcase of creativity , an expression of artistic skill , and, above all, the ultimate in Insta -worthy #foodporn . And now, there’s a whole genre of baking that has grown up around the idea of cake -making as an artform : cake decorating. I’m sure you know what I mean . I saw a particularly stunning cake the other day : a pink meringue nest , covered in edible pearls .

Some TOPS members are part of other weight-loss groups at the YMCA . MANSFIELD - A group of teenagers were recognized last month for their work in helping others lose weight and adopt healthy lifestyle choices. The group of eight teenagers is part of Teens on a Plan to Slim, a program for teenagers who want to lose weight and adopt healthier ways to eat and exercise. But, their work goes beyond the walls of the organization, as they are part of a new group at the Mansfield YMCA, the F.U.N. Club, or Fitting and Uniting for Health.

Lunchtime concert at St George's URC. Third 2018 lunchtime concert at St George’s United Reformed Church, Morpeth. Eilidh Gillespie (flute) and Nick Byrne (cello) made a welcome return to the latest lunchtime concert. They were joined by Eilidh’s pupil Isabella Thorneycroft and pianist Alison Gill. While Eilidh, Nick and Alison are seasoned campaigners, Isabella is only 16 years old and attends Kings Priory School in Tynemouth. She is, however, a member of the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain. The programme was most challenging and varied, consisting of five compositions.

Ex-Communications Director Anthony Scaramucci had extensive plans for President Trump's communications department before he was booted from the White House, according to his memo. The memo published on Medium Wednesday by right-wing media personality Mike Cernovich details Scaramucci's vision to reform the White House's communications department. It lists his five priorities, which are: "Improve the Culture," "Comms is a Customer Service Operation — POTUS is the Number One Customer," "Make the News — We Go First," "Fill the Content Void," and "Jobs, Jobs, Jobs."

Why do we only hear about Jasper Johns when he gets ripped off ? Jasper Johns is the greatest artist to come from America since the 50s. It seems as if he is the only one that matters in America. Why do we only hear about him when he is getting ripped off ? It seems like this story should be about the artist. I can only think of one article about the work that has ever appeared in artforum. The other ones are all about Jasper Johns, and about his lawsuit. I wonder if people think that is what the article is about when they pick it up.

The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India ( Irdai ) has proposed to ask some insurance companies to mandatorily include critical illness cover in all health insurance policies. The proposal is aimed at offering protection to the policy-holders at a reduced cost and to ensure that hospitals are compensated by the insurer, a move that will bring more clarity to the industry and offer more stability to the sector. If the proposal is accepted, then insurers will have to offer cover of up to Rs 2 lakh per year at no extra premium to policy- holders.

You have to give Square Enix points for honesty; Bravely Default: For the Sequel wears its primary intentions right on its sleeve. I mean, it's right in the title: "For the Sequel." The new updated version of the original Bravely Default: Flying Fairy is currently being developed in parallel to the game's upcoming as-of-yet untitled sequel. However, unlike your standard updated rerelease of a game, Square Enix is looking to use For the Sequel as a testing bed for the sequel (Christ, how many times am I going to have to use that term.).

One minute he was strutting around the end zone , staring into the stands , the look of a stone-cold slayer on his face. Then he was back to being the same guy you know, the same guy you saw on Monday, or Saturday, or whenever you last saw him. He wasn’t wearing an expression of victory or glory. He wore a look of confusion, maybe shock. The 22 year-old running back who has spent the first four games of this season carrying the hopes of the entire franchise, had just broken his ankle on the second-to-last play before halftime.

You have to give Square Enix points for honesty ; Bravely Default : For the Sequel wears its primary intentions firmly upon its sleeve. This is not, nor is it aiming to be, a traditional RPG. It is a hybrid. This is Square Enix giving us something different. It is a dungeon crawler of sorts and the battles are very much in the realm of Dragon Quest. But it also contains elements of RPGs like Star Ocean or Final Fantasy. This is a strange mix and in a way it feels like the game was made by a committee.

The Bridge City Cardinals are the boys 22-4A district champions in tennis. The team participated in the district tournament in Beaumont last week. Taking home the silver medal in Boys Singles was Lorenz Schrader. Schrader played an epic four hour match in the finals before falling 5-7; 7-5; 7-6 (5) to Hardin Jefferson. In the Boys Doubles division, the Perry brothers once again dominated. Camden and Kian dropped only two games in their move thru the bracket. Also in the Boys Doubles, Salvador Torres and Alberto Munguia captured the bronze medal for the Cardinals.

Palomar San Diego and Shorebreak Hotel in Huntington Beach are feeling festive over Feb. 29 . Staying at the Shorebreak Hotel is just a 1-minute walk to the water, the Huntington Pier and the beach, and a 3-minute walk from Huntington Beach’s Main Street, where guests can stroll along surf and skate culture shops and restaurants. The hotel’s two oceanfront pools, spa, barbecue areas and fire pits, along with a fitness room, business center and laundry facilities are great places to lounge. The Shorebreak hotel also includes a surf school, yoga classes and a game room.

NSA Director General Keith Alexander maintains that his agency 's tactics are lawful and used against foreign adversaries . The NSA has defended its mass-surveillance program after revelations made by Edward Snowden. MOSCOW, November 5 (RIA Novosti) – United States spy agency the National Security Agency (NSA) is capable of listening in on every foreign and domestic phone call made by Americans, media reported on Monday. According to the Washington Post, the spy agency has the ability to collect and store all phone calls made through a vast majority of networks, including landlines and mobile phones, regardless of what country they originate or end in.

She said other Ladies in White in Pedro Betancourt were prevented by police from joining them in Perico . HAVANA (AP) Cuba's crackdown on dissent intensified Monday as a group of female activists were briefly detained after trying to carry out their usual weekly protest in the eastern province of Guantanamo. A group of more than 100 Ladies in White marched along a road near the U.S. naval base in Guantanamo Bay demanding the freedom of the group's 56 members and 35 other political prisoners. State security agents surrounded the activists at one point and used pepper gas to disperse the crowd.

The proxy owner and publicity officer of a private event-organising company , who were arrested on charges of organising the event without approval, were today released on bail by the Bandaragama Magistrate's Court. The two men are the owner of the company, K.P. Dilan Fernando and the publicity officer, S.W. Sathisara. They had been arrested following complaints by some residents, who were angered by the noise during the event. They were released on the condition they will have to attend court on each of the hearing dates and pay a cash bond of Rs. 2000.

Tacko Fall, who stands 7’5″, is unstoppable. Likely the tallest player in high school basketball, he’s always turning heads in the gym. “Everywhere I go, people want to take pictures, talk to me, shake my hand, but I’m getting used to it now,” the Tavares (Fla.) Liberty Christian Prep junior told the Orlando Sentinel last year. Fall arrived in Florida from Dakar, Senegal with little to no organized basketball experience. He has also lived in Texas, Ohio and Tennessee.

Millions of refugees have fled their homes in war-torn Syria since 2011 . President Barack Obama previously planned to resettle 65,000 refugees in the US. Now, President Trump's administration has slashed that goal in half. Trump has said his administration is focusing on taking care of the people of America first. But immigrant rights advocates say the cuts will affect people fleeing persecution who are not dangerous. So, if 50,000 immigrant visas are issued, how are they divided amongst the different categories of visas? And what are the implications for the millions of Syrians and other refugees fleeing war, persecution, and violence abroad?

Could Washington state elect the greenest governor in the nation? All around the country this election season, we’ve got Democrats who don’t want to talk about climate change and Republicans who don’t even acknowledge that climate change is real. But in the Washington state governor’s race, it’s a whole different ballgame. The Democrat, Jay Inslee, is a longtime, outspoken crusader for climate action and clean energy. The Republican, Rob McKenna, is one of a vanishing breed of Republicans who not only acknowledge that climate change is happening but support government action to fight it.

Need help navigating WG earnings? Following the market opening Tuesday, the Dow traded down 0.34 percent to 17,731.95 while the NASDAQ dipped 0.56 percent to 5,074.14. The S&P also fell, dropping 0.43 percent to 2,077.67. In trading on Tuesday, energy shares were relative leaders, up on the day by about 1.41 percent. Meanwhile, top gainers in the sector included Willbros Group Inc (NYSE: WG), up 11 percent, and GulfMark Offshore, Inc. (NYSE: GLF), up 8 percent. Telecommunications services sector was the top loser in the US market on Tuesday.

U.S. President Donald Trump attends a swearing in ceremony for senior staff at the White House in Washington , DC on January 22, 2017 (SAUL LOEB/AFP/Getty Images)
A former top U.S. diplomat in the Obama administration told lawmakers Tuesday that President Trump’s first phone call in office to Ukrainian President Zelensky was “inappropriate,” and suggested Trump’s decision to hold up military aid to the country was “dangerous and unacceptable.”
The testimony by former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine Marie Yovanovitch marked the beginning of what is expected to be two days of closed-door impeachment testimony by former officials.

Holwell Sports reached their first Senior County Cup final in 17 years on Tuesday evening after a penalty shoot-out win over Heather St Johns. John Webster’s side raced into an early two-goal lead but were left hanging on through 90 minutes and then extra time as Heather fought back to level. A nerveless and clinical display then won them the shoot-out 4-1 as Holwell booked their place in the final against Leicester Road on Tuesday, May 2. Assistant manager Andy Hill said: “I thought Heather were a very good footballing side, and it was a hard-fought win for us rather than a brilliant performance.

AFC Fylde’s match at Torquay United has been postponed following a Friday morning pitch inspection at Plainmoor. The match had been in doubt following the week’s cold weather and a decision was made after an 8.30am inspection. A Torquay statement read: “The South West suffered heavy snowfall on Thursday, and it has made travel a near impossibility for home and away fans, as well as travelling teams. “Due to the current travel conditions the club is closed today. “We hope that everyone has remained safe during this time, and look forward to welcoming everyone back to Plainmoor soon.

It was a bountiful year for books in English by Quebec writers. Ian McGillis looks back at some of his favourites. Now, it’s a matter of cutting it down — agonizingly, painfully. Apologies, then, to the many books and writers — some of them featured in these very pages over the past year — who don’t appear below.

Sunkett said the running back positions are still up from grabs and that the ground attack will be by committee, at least early in season. A young East St. Louis defensive unit gave up a lot of points a year ago. With three starters returning on the defensive line, a group of strong and quick linebackers and a secondary, which will be led by Thomas, the Flyers should be better this fall. Gone up front is all-American defensive end Terry Beckner Jr . — now at the University of Missouri — but LaMontre’ Harvey, Antuan Quinlin and Terres Lagrome, are quick agile linemen who return.

Against the odds , Auburn Smith , 16 , has become a nationally ranked wheelchair tennis player . She will be travelling to the BNP Paribas Masters in France in August and the US Open in New York in September in the under-18 singles , wheelchair singles and doubles. PHOTOS: JOCELYN DALLING Image may contain: people , sports equipment , tennis racket and outdoor Auburn's story is one of inspiration and dedication . It is a story of what she calls a ''fresh start''. ''If I had been able to walk, I would have just been another 16 year old,'' she said.

Plushenko’s glorious career was finished. He had hoped to cap it at home after a comeback from spinal surgery, which he did, partially, by helping Russia win the team competition. But his 31-year-old back, after all those years of wrenching revolutions and hard landings, gave out two nights too soon. In essence, Plushenko sacrificed his chance at another individual medal to put his country on top. He was a longshot for gold, but in a sport of sequins and stuffed animals, he brought pugnacious sizzle. He was the James Cagney of the ice.

The British are known for their collective stiff upper lip. The elements of British style translate easily in every region, even in the subtropics. A comfortable armchair, slipcovers, small prints, antiques and wicker furniture are all British touches that look good anywhere. -- Slipcovers. On sofas, on chairs, on pillows. ''Chintzes and paisleys look great even in this climate,'' said Melissa B. Luetgert of Designers Age in Naples, Fla.
-- Patterns. Leafy designs, white-on-white and chintzes are showing up on upholstery, wall coverings and accent pieces.

( CNN ) -- France 's Michel Desjoyeaux won the Vendee Globe solo round the world yacht race for a second time in record time. The 40-year-old from La Rochelle, who completed the course in just 74 days, seven hours and 17 minutes, broke his own record time by one day, 11 hours and 18 minutes. The previous record, set in the 2000 race, was 84 days. Ironically Desjoyeaux also holds the race record for finishing last. In 2004 he was dismasted 1,450 nautical miles into the race and had to be airlifted to safety off the Canary Islands.

John Bennett ( July 20 ) , a teacher at Westside Middle School , was upset by the School Board’s vote to cut 75 teachers and 38 other employees. “It’s very sad for the children and staff that have to live with these decisions that don’t seem right,” Bennett said. Bennett , 56 , has spent most of his life working with students and teachers in the public schools . He has been a teacher at Westside Middle for 30 years and was the head basketball coach at Northside Middle School for 12 seasons. “It’s very unfair.

It has seemed for a while as though the global financial storm was going to deal a mostly glancing blow to Canada. The government of the United States has taken some drastic steps to stem the crisis by buying equities and increasing liquidity through lower interest rates. But on Tuesday, the Canadian markets took a major hit and have continued to fall on the following days, with the markets now down almost 15 per cent since September. There are a number of reasons that Canadian financial markets would be negatively impacted by an American financial crisis.

Chipolo Plus is supposedly the loudest Bluetooth item tracker available today , and its chirpy tune can be heard from more than 100 feet away, even when playing music at 70dB. You can find your lost items by activating the tune, or simply by opening the FindChipolo app. If you want to track your misplaced items with Chipolo Plus, just open the app and press the button on the top of the Chipolo Plus, then you can see a map in the App with a little blue dot, which shows the location of the lost item.

The Toronto real estate market is showing signs of stirring from its deep freeze , with new listings starting to creep up, says the latest Toronto Real Estate Board (TREB) market update. April sales were 12.8 per cent above the sales level of last year. The number of new listings was down by 26 per cent compared to last year but up by 12.4 per cent compared to March . The average price of homes in the GTA (not including condos) in April was $501,163, down 12 per cent from last year and up 8.7 per cent over March , TREB says.

Sympathetically converted 2 bedroom pent house apartment in the heart of the village . The Coach House is situated in the centre of the village of Stainfield, 10 minutes walk to the station. The village has a convenience store and post office within a minutes walk. This is a beautifully restored and decorated coach house, retaining many of its historical features. The open plan lounge and kitchen has exposed beams, original brickwork and the original oak floor boards throughout. There is a modern fitted kitchen with dishwasher, washer dryer, microwave and fridge freezer.

Born June 9th, 1951, Willem "Wim" Smith passed on August 2nd, 2017. Wim was the son of Raymond and Margaret May Smith who both preceded him in death. He is survived by three brothers; Cole (Toni), Gage, and Scott (Piper). Wim was a native son of the State of Nevada and lived in several Western Nevada locales however his most favorite place was "The Moon" located in northern Elko County near Wildhorse Reservoir. Wim was a long time building contractor in Carson Valley and built many fine custom homes in the Valley.

FABIO CAPELLO is celebrating a happy hat-trick as he leads England into the last match of the season at Wembley. It’s 25 years since he won the FA Cup with Milan and on Sunday he will be looking for his third successive victory as England manager when Wales come to the national stadium. He won the League Cup with Juventus in 2001-2002 and in the last four years he has led England into two major finals and the World Cup. He won the League Cup with Juventus in 2003 and was in charge when England beat France at Wembley in the European Championships quarter-final.

An SEO named William Stanley was sentenced to more than three years in prison and ordered to pay $174,888 in fees for SEO extortion. US Attorney John Parker of the Northern District of Texas announced an SEO named William Stanley has been sentenced to 37 months in federal prison and ordered to pay $174,888 in restitution to a dozen identified victims for attempting to extort money from a business in Dallas. In November 2009, GE entered into a contract with Stanley for SEO services and reputation management. Stanley was hired because of his ability to improve a firm’s online reputation through search results.

WASHINGTON — Thousands of commuters across the region were delayed Thursday morning by an apparent work action by Metro ’s rail operators’ union. At the height of the disruption, trains were operating at roughly half the usual speed, Metro said on its Web site, and some were operating with only a single car. Metro’s chief executive, Richard Sarles, was quoted by The Washington Post as saying that the delays were the result of operators purposely slowing trains. At the Federal Aviation Administration, officials were forced to relocate employees temporarily.

This is the ninth dispatch in a series from Jeff Goodell, who will be investigating the effect of climate change on Thwaites glacier. At about 5 a.m. last Tuesday morning, at latitude 74 degrees 57.4 S and longitude 106 12.8 W on the remote coast of West Antarctica, Thwaites glacier loomed up out of the fog and revealed itself to us. Peter Sheehan, a witty and hard-working 27-year-old researcher from the U.K.’s University of East Anglia, was one of the first scientists aboard the Nathaniel B. Palmer to lay eyes on it.

The Nicholls softball team staged a strong defensive effort Wednesday night against Southern Mississippi in its home opener at Swanner Field in Thibodaux. Nicholls State stifled the Golden Eagles at the plate, while taking advantage of three errors in the 4-1 non-conference victory. Colonels pitcher Megan Landry earned the win with four strikeouts, a walk and by scattering three hits in six innings. Southern Miss pitcher Abby Trahan took the loss despite six strikeouts, two walks and allowing five hits. "It was a bit of a chess match in the beginning," Colonels coach Angel Santiago said.

SAN FRANCISCO (MarketWatch) -- Jennifer Mehaffey was lucky to have enjoyed a seven-month leave to be with and breastfeed her baby daughter before going back to work full-time. Once she returned to her job, her goal was to supply breast milk for her daughter's first full year, said Mehaffey, 31, a marketing and public relations professional in Tuscaloosa, Ala. She pumped milk in her office at least three times a day, she said, until keeping up with it interfered with the many long meetings and client calls she had to juggle. Then "the incident" happened.

It’s been a rough couple of years for the Rebels. They’ve been down so long they’ve forgotten what up really feels like. They’re hungry to get back there and they think they’re ready to do so. But it’ll take some luck. Last season Teurlings struggled in the regular season. They won just one game.

Teaching language to an artificial intelligence system is child’s play, thanks to MIT. Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology developed a parser that imitates kids’ learning processes by observing the environment and making connections. The system studies captioned videos and learns to associate words with objects and actions. When given a new sentence, the parser can accurately predict its meaning—without visual clues. This “weakly supervised” approach, which requires limited training input, could expand the types of data and reduce the effort needed for training parsers. Annotations can certainly speed up the process, but they’re not needed to learn.

This week , in a closed-door meeting of Congressional Democrats with President Obama , Representative Ed Perlmutter of Colorado bluntly told the president that there was no way his party’s candidates could win a majority in either the House or the Senate unless the president took a much tougher approach toward Republicans, especially if they refused to agree to increase the federal minimum wage. “The bottom line is this: If we don’t take back the House, the only way we’re going to get it done is when we get a presidential signature,” Perlmutter said.

REDMOND, Wash. and WENATCHEE, Wash., April 12, 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- Microsoft Corp. today announced new agreements to boost clean energy and connectivity in Washington state. The two agreements with Chelan County Public Utility District (PUD) will see Microsoft receive carbon-free electricity to power its Puget Sound campuses and partner with the PUD on broadband connectivity in Chelan County. "This agreement provides much more than renewable energy for Microsoft — it's an investment in new opportunities for communities in central Washington and the competitiveness of Washington state," said Shelley McKinley, general manager, Technology and Corporate Responsibility, Microsoft.

The OLCC is cracking down on marijuana retailers that sell to minors . PORTLAND , Ore. – A rule increasing the penalties for retailers that sell marijuana to minors will take effect July 1, 2017. The law was approved as part of House Bill 3460, which went into effect on January 1, 2016, establishing a comprehensive framework for both the medical and nonmedical marijuana programs, as well as recreational cannabis. The OLCC’s enforcement efforts are the result of House Bill 3410, which passed in February 2016 and is designed to reduce the rate of sales of marijuana to minors statewide.

The percentage of overweight and obese adults in Lancashire is almost 1% higher than the national average (64.7% compared to 63.8%). The first annual report produced by Lancashire’s Director of Public Health has highlighted the fact that while people are living longer, they are often facing years of ill-health at the end of their lives. • While people are generally living longer, life expectancy and the number of years for which people enjoy good health in Lancashire are less than the national average. • Work to address health inequalities is needed both in deprived communities and more affluent ones.

A new study for The New York Times reveals that the media pay for the top 200 CEOs is now $14.5 million. This is up 55 in the last year. While any one CEO may be well worth his/her raise, it is a growing political and PR problem for corporate America to be seen as rewarding those at the top, with little consideration for actual performance. For millions of Americans who are unemployed, under employed and being foreclosed on, it seems inconceivable that corporate CEOs can be getting significant raises at a time of such economic hardship.

The proxy owner and publicity officer of a private event-organising company, who were arrested on charges of organising the Wadduwa beach party where four people died, were today remanded till August 17 by Panadura Additional Magistrate Kalhari Liyanage. The suspects, Amila Pushpakumara and Eranda Danthanarayana were produced in Court by the Wadduwa Police Crime Branch Sub Inspector K.A.S.W. Sugath. Submitting the report on the police investigations, he said the Government Analyst and Assistant Government Analyst visited the hotel and conducted investigations. SI Sigath said the police also carried out an investigation into the tragedy that occurred at the beach party on August 4 attended by some 2,000 people.

Media & Entertainment I write about women in the business of Hollywood . New research released today from the Geena Davis Institute shows that women and people of color are not only underrepresented on screen but that gender disparity has become more severe over the last two decades, particularly in popular genres like action, fantasy and adventure. The study, which looked at 118 top films released between 2010 and 2015 , found that women comprised 31% of all major characters. In top-grossing films (films which grossed over $300 million), women accounted for 34%, while men made up 66% of all main characters.

My research aims to improve our understanding of how cells with the same genome can develop dramatically different behaviors. For example, consider the mechanical abilities of a muscle cell compared to the electrical excitability of a neuron, or the industrious activity of bone building cells in a youthful person compared to an elderly one. Each of these cells, (if taken from the same individual) has an identical genome — and yet each is “reading” a very distinct subset of that genome and consequently carrying out very different behaviors. The choice of what to read and what to hide away is made during development.

How will fuel prices and driving in Europe be affected by Brexit? Following the momentous decision taken today by United Kingdom voters to leave the European Union, a British motoring association has warned fuel prices, driving in Europe and motor insurance could all be affected. The Automobile Association (AA) has said fuel prices are set to rise during a period of instability as the market begins to adjust to the news that Britons have voted to leave the EU. Driving abroad will also change, with drivers having to display a GB sign with the potential of a fine for those that don’t.

Chrissy Teigen and John Legend arrive at the Oscars on Feb. 26, 2017 at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. Chrissy Teigen is loving life on vacation and, judging by a new post, her hubby John Legend isn’t the only singer in the house. Teigen, the model and activist, shared a video of herself goofing around with an inflatable flamingo by a pool and singing “Thank You For Being A Friend,” the theme for The Golden Girls, a hugely popular sitcom in the 1980s and early 1990s. Teigen’s version has a fresh set of lyrics tailored to her lush surroundings.

Following a team of international scientists , this film exclusively documents an archeological sensation : the exploration of royal tombs from the 5th dynasty, 2500 BC, of the Old Egyptian Empire. In 1996, in a hidden chamber beneath the stately pyramid at Saqqara, Egypt, a long-sought after royal burial of the 5th Egyptian Dynasty, 2500 B.C., was discovered. With this film, you will be permitted to join the expedition on the discovery of the 5th-dynasty pyramid tombs . The team of international archeologist is led by the Egyptologist Dr. Zahi Hawass.

An injury at work left a husband and father facing a layoff . He could n't return to the job he loved. It was devastating . At that time, the job market was tough and finding a job was very difficult . His employer's short term disability insurance would n't cover his income . His family's finances were falling apart . He had already spent his savings . He had no way of paying medical bills . He couldn't pay for utilities . His credit was ruined . It seemed like there was no way out of the financial mess he was in .

German scientists working on the Wendelstein 7-X fusion device started a series of experiments that could eventually prove the superiority of fusion over nuclear fission power plants. They fired up the device’s first plasma on Dec. 10 and will begin a six-month series of tests. If it works, it could mean a future of fusion reactors as well as a better understanding of our universe. “I think that we could be the generation that solves the climate problem,” one researcher working on the project, Tobias Wohlfahrt, told MIT Technology Review.

A year ago , Palos Verdes came on strong at the end of the regular season and dominated during the CIF-SS Division 5 semifinal playoffs to earn a championship berth before falling to Cathedral in the final game. This season , the Sea Kings have been even better and have a 12-4 record heading into tonight's CIF-SS Division 5 semifinal at Redlands. Palos Verdes scored 50 runs during a four-game winning streak and is averaging 8.4 runs in its last 13 games. "The kids know that we've had some pretty good teams in the past, but it's a new team each year," Palos Verdes Coach Jim Knapp said.

Bloxx kick off their latest jaunt across the UK with a headline gig at the Craufurd Arms on Wednesday nextweek. The Uxbridge quartet released their debut EP Headspace last month. The record features past singles Headspace and Sea Blue which was released at the end of last year following a 20-date tour which included a sold-out show at London Borderline. Bloxx’s latest UK tour takes them across the country in April and includes festival appearances at Reading and Leeds, Liverpool’s Sound City, Live At Leeds and at Sheffield’s Tramlines later this summer.

The first image of Earth from lunar orbit . Before an Apollo-era NASA could launch a few humans on top of an expensive rocket, they would first prove that Earth’s largest satellite could support human life in orbit. Soon after it successfully launched the first astronaut in space , Project Mercury turned to the next test of mankind’s potential in space. In 1961, the program sent the first chimpanzee to the moon, called Ham. The flight took place in late January, when Mercury was in conjunction with the sun and the moon was in its new moon phase.

This morning, Lieutenant Governor Brian Dubie formally kicked off his third re-election campaign by promising to improve the Vermont economy and strengthen laws against child sexual assault. Former state Representative Thomas Costello of Brattleboro took a step toward returning to Montpelier, winning the Democratic primary for lieutenant governor. Two democratic candidates for Lieutenant Governor are highlighting different issues. A second Democrat is entering the race for Vermont’s lieutenant governor, setting up a primary race to choose a candidate to challenge Republican incumbent Brian Dubie. Republican Lieutenant Governor Brian Dubie says he’ll be a candidate for re-election this fall.

Security researchers at Kaspersky Lab say they 've discovered the first virus designed to infect iPods . Called `` Podloso , `` it's a parasite that spreads to the iPod's hard disk while the iPod is docked on a Windows PC. When you sync the iPod to iTunes, you unintentionally transfer Podloso to the iTunes library, from where it travels to any other PCs used for syncing. Once it reaches the user's PC, it begins to infect all applications with an autorun feature, including Windows itself, which makes it very difficult to remove.

The Frewsburg Central School board of education received an update Thursday on the capital project that began last spring . The project is on time and on or under budget at every step thus far. The district hopes to be completely done before the students return from the holiday recess on January 3rd. In an unfortunate accident at the school last Friday a student was burned severely when a propane heater exploded. She is recovering in ECMC but is still unable to return to school. The board voted to have the state safety inspector review the accident and give recommendations.

Even as its board expresses interest in building a branch museum downtown (see "City for challenges. "), the National World War II Aviation Museum has big plans for its current Colorado Springs Airport spot. According to its website, the museum plans to build a new 72,000 square-foot aircraft display hangar and an 86,000 square-foot building to house new exhibit galleries, an events center, and a state-of-the-art education facility. The museum has received a $1 million grant from the Slattery Family Foundation to fund design of the project, which will be built by GE Johnson Construction and designed by CSNA Architects.

Selkirk Avenue was closed down for several hours by a fire. At around 10 a.m. Monday, Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service crews responded to a fire in a vacant commercial building in the 400 block of Selkirk. Crews evacuated nearby buildings as a precaution and one individual from a neighbouring building was assessed on scene. The road was closed to traffic for around two and a half hours. Officials said that the fire progressed into the roof of an attached residential-style portion of the building. Crews contained the fire to the building of origin using several handheld hose lines and an aerial ladder for safety.

If you live along the Eastern Seaboard and wake up early Friday you could be treated to a colorful sky thanks to Hurricane Jose passing by. This satellite view shows Hurricane Jose just before it was downgraded to a tropical storm. The outer bands of Hurricane Jose are expected to bring some rain and wind to areas along the coast from Maine to New York and as far south as North Carolina. The storm will weaken, but it is still expected to bring up to 3 to 6 inches of rain from New England to eastern Virginia, the Weather Channel said.

SUNRISE, Fla. -- The New York Rangers weren't necessarily impressed with their performance Wednesday night, but they weren't going to complain about their bounce-back effort. Two nights after being shut out by the Tampa Bay Lightning and seeing goalie Henrik Lundqvist pulled, the Rangers rebounded with a 5-2 victory against the Florida Panthers. The Rangers appeared headed for an easy victory when they led 3-0 midway through the third period, but they had to respond after Florida cut the lead to 3-2 on goals by Scottie Upshall and Nick Bjugstad less than four minutes apart.

A truck slammed into a fire hydrant on Western Avenue in San Pedro on Thursday morning , creating a geyser of water as high as the second floor of an apartment building nearby. The accident was reported around 10:30 a.m. near 1004 Western Ave. in San Pedro, according to Los Angeles fire and police officials. The crash caused water to gush out of the hydrant and soak the street, a car parked nearby and a two-story apartment building near 10th and Western, according to the Los Angeles Fire Department. The driver of the truck and a passenger in the vehicle were reported to be unharmed.

The 2014 Chevrolet Camaro Z28 . DETROIT — General Motors is recalling more cars for problems with ignition switches . The automaker announced Monday it's calling back 2010-2014 Camaro and 2010-2015 Cadillac models to fix a problem with the ignition switch. The recall is expected to cost GM more than $200 million. The announcement is another blow to GM, which is still recovering from a 2014 recall of 2.6 million small cars that were found to have similar ignition switch problems. It led to the recall of 2.6 million small cars worldwide and at least 13 deaths.

The Bermuda Police Service warned people of fraudsters trying to get their personal information from phone calls or e-mails . In an e-mail to the press, a police spokesperson said: “On Monday, December 5, 2016, police were alerted to an incident of criminal impersonation whereby a man representing himself to be a member of the police staff contacted members of the public in order to obtain personal information, as well as a sum of money. “Investigating officers are in the process of making inquiries to determine the circumstances of this incident.

The Volstead Act was repealed on this date in 1933, returning control of alcohol to the states, and it was a happy day at the F.X. Matt Brewery. UTICA, N.Y. -- A total of 85 years ago Wednesday marked the end of prohibition, which meant legally drinking beer again. And for the Matt family from Utica – that meant getting back to selling beer again. They let customers and suppliers know that at midnight, they could deliver, buy, and drink beer at the brewery once again. The local business managed to survive 13 years.

It looks like you guys are very prepared for having two new babies in the family!

After all, there are some delightful restaurants in Bratislava, and this gastronomic oasis is 140 kilometers away. Why should we encourage you to take this drive? Simply, it is a combination of the people, the food, and the service.

From Madonna to Sam Smith , Taylor posed with everyone ! As was made evident in Taylor Swift 's introductory video for the 57th Annual GRAMMYs , it seems as though the pop singer has a knack for befriending celebrities. The song is about a "boy who doesn't think he'll ever be in love", so perhaps it's a love song written from the perspective of her new husband. "It's very important to us that our story is told from our perspective", the Kardashian told Entertainment Tonight last year .

STARSPORT brings you the latest transfer news and gossip from Upton Park . West Ham have had a club-record £31m bid accepted for Valencia starlet Paco Alcacer. The 22-year-old attacker has scored 33 goals in just 65 appearances for Valencia since breaking into their first-team in 2011. Manchester United star Robin van Persie is a £6m transfer target for West Ham after the Dutchman told Red Devil boss Louis Van Gaal he wants out this summer. Hammers boss Sam Allardyce is keen to strengthen his strikeforce and wants to bolster the attack with a top-class goalscorer.

Boeing ’ s latest setback , a deal between Tesla and Fiat Chrysler , and Pinterest ’ s valuation were some of the topics on our minds this week at Barron’s Advisors. The Chicago-based company said its fourth-quarter earnings would be lower than expected following two recent crashes of its new 737 Max jet. The stock plunged about 12% in premarket trade, but the market reaction is an overreaction because the plane is only 0.4% of Boeing’s revenue, said Barron’s. The electric-car maker and FCA said Tuesday they will partner to produce a zero-emissions truck and SUV in five years’ time.

Balancethebudget , a New York-based runner who has had some success at Pimlico , is the likely favorite in the fourth race at 4:12 p.m. today, a first-condition allowance race of a mile. Pennsyltucky (2-to-1) is a 3-year-old who was second in his only other race at Laurel last month, and will be trying two turns for the first time in his career, and that is why he’s the second choice. Also in the field are two horses that won last time out at Pimlico. The one who won by 14 lengths is a newcomer for trainer Graham Motion and is making only his second start.

The British are known for their collective stiff upper lip . The elements of British style translate easily in everyday life. Here is a small list of pieces that make the English style timeless and easy to wear, and how to style them. Mary Janes :
First of all, the Mary Jane is an American shoe that was first made by the Boston Shoe company in the 1870s. It was given the name of Mary Jane after a stage name of one of the first celebrities. This shoe became fashionable for women in the 20s. It is still worn by young children today.

Labour leader Ed Miliband doesn't have an image problem, he has a policy problem. The problem is he doesn't have any, or at least policies that answer the gravity of the situation. Millions of people suffer as inflation outstrips wages. The cost of food, transport, fuel and housing skyrocket. A million people have visited food banks. This is not only a joyless recovery, for the vast majority of people it's a moneyless one. A smirking George Osborne may don a hi-vis jacket and march through building sites in Northern England to boast of recovery.

Why do we only hear about Jasper Johns when he gets ripped off? Jasper Johns is the greatest artist alive. It seems a shame that he only enters the headlines when people rip him off. Johns was in court this week to give evidence against a Queens, New York foundry owner, Brian Ramnarine, who has now pleaded guilty to faking one of the artist's works. It was a bronze version of one of the most iconic of all American paintings: Flag. Johns had made four bronze copies of Flag in 1960 at Ramnarine's foundry.

London ( AP ) — An iceberg four miles wide has broken off from a glacier in eastern Greenland and scientists are racing to determine whether it could threaten a nearby village that is home to about 175 people. A NASA satellite captured a view of the huge iceberg Tuesday, the same day villagers in the town of Innaarsuit reported a big, blue iceberg just off their shore. It is still 18 miles away and does not pose any immediate threat, Greenland police said Tuesday. But if it gets too close, it could pose a serious threat, they added.

Media & Entertainment I write about women in the business of Hollywood. New research released today from the Geena Davis Institute on Gender and Media shows that we have a long way to go in our depictions of girls and women onscreen in family-friendly movies. It also showed that countries around the world must do a better job of employing women because, when they do, we see more women and girls onscreen. In their previous research, Dr. Stacy L. Smith, Marc Choueiti, & Dr. Katherine Pieper at the USC Annenberg School of Communications, looked at G, PG and PG-13 rated movies that were released in the US.

Herbert Davis and MRA are looking to get back to the title game after failing to do so for the past two years. During the 2000 campaign, Davis led the Hurricanes to the Class 4A state semifinal round. He then guided MRA to the title game last year before falling short 14-7 to Tuscaloosa ACA at Legion Field. The two-time Class 4A state champion coach is 13-1 in the state playoffs over the past four years. MRA has won seven consecutive games and 13 of its past 14 contests entering this week's Class 4A, Region 3 opener at Tuscaloosa Academy.

Some Zimbabwe government supporters say President Robert Mugabe should form a government without the opposition, following an opposition boycott of talks Monday in Swaziland. Tendai Maphosa asked ordinary Zimbabweans in Harare what they think about this latest threat to the power-sharing deal signed last month and reports for VOA. After failing to agree on the allocation of Cabinet posts last week, Zimbabwe's ruling ZANU-PF party and the opposition Movement for Democratic Change decided to refer the matter to the Southern African Development Community. They agreed to meet with SADC representatives earlier this week, but that meeting never took place.

BETHANY, Okla. -- A hospital for disabled children in Bethany has organized an Olympic Games for their young residents, children with severe disabilities. The Children's Center held an "opening ceremonies" Monday night. Jonathan Northcott, 14, is recovering from a leg surgery and has been living at The Children's Center since June. Northcott sang the National Anthem during the opening ceremonies. "That was actually my first time ever singing in front of a big crowd. I've never sang in front of anyone before. I was nervous," Northcott said.

Big money is gearing up in opposition to the statewide effort to repeal the Costa-Hawkins Rental Housing Act.
