Evo Morales, Bolivia's president-elect, fresh from meetings with the leaders of Cuba and Venezuela, says that his country welcomes foreign investors, but it will not relinquish control of its natural resources. "Bolivia needs partners, foreign investors, but not owners of our natural resources," Morales told reporters on Wednesday in Madrid where he was stopping as part of a continuing tour that includes visits to France, Belgium, South Africa, China and Brazil. "My government ... is going to exercise its property right over its natural resources."

SHAH ALAM ( THE STAR/ASIA NEWS NETWORK ) - The High Court in Shah Alam has rejected a bid to set aside the appointment of former attorney-general Tan Sri Abu Talib Othman as an election commissioner. The court on Thursday (April 4) rejected a judicial review application filed by a group called the Committee to Restore the Judiciary to challenge the decision by the Prime Minister to appoint the 68-year-old lawyer as a member of the commission. The five-man panel chaired by Justice Aziah Ali said that the applicant failed to meet the test under the law. The decision is final and is not subject to appeal.

Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi routinely lands up at the airport to receive world dignitaries . From the moment a visiting dignitary lands at New Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International Airport to the last minute when they are ushered off, everything is done with a great deal of respect and affection. It is not uncommon for Modi to personally receive the dignitaries at the airport . He has been doing it with such regularity, it might just be a norm now. In the past week, Modi has received a string of high-profile visitors at the airport, including Afghan President Ashraf Ghani and the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammad bin Salman.

New Delhi: The ruling Communist Party of India (Marxist), or CPM, is prepared for a fight against the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in assembly elections due in Tripura this year, CPM general secretary Sitaram Yechury said on Tuesday, adding: “Tripura will be the BJP’s Waterloo." Separately, in a letter to finance minister Arun Jaitley, Yechury criticized the central government’s decision to introduce electoral bonds which he said was a “regressive move" and a route for “dubious funds". He said that the bonds will have an effect in the upcoming polls in Tripura as well.

For Bruce Logan, microbes are an electrifying subject. The Kappe professor of environmental engineering at Pennsylvania State University works on creating alternative-fuel cells powered by anaerobic bacteria. "Because these bacteria breathe without oxygen they will transfer electrons from their food outside their bodies to an electrode," he says. Enough bacteria doing this at the same time will generate a current. At just a few millivolts It won't charge a phone, but it's enough to get a reading. Drill a hole for the copper wire in the lid of each container.

JERUSALEM — The face-off at the security gate outside the Western Wall one Friday this month was familiar: for more than two decades, women have been making a monthly pilgrimage to pray at one of Judaism’s holiest sites in a manner traditionally preserved for men, and the police have stopped them in the name of maintaining public order. But after a flurry of arrests this fall that set off an international outcry, the women arrived for December’s service to find a new protocol ordered by the ultra-Orthodox rabbi who controls the site.

Tim Hortons and an association representing some of its frustrated franchisees are close to reaching a settlement in two class-action lawsuits that could cost the coffee chain millions of dollars. The two sides confirmed on Tuesday they’re close to reaching a deal. The lawsuits claim Tim Hortons, a Canadian company, has used misleading advertising to inflate perceptions of its iconic status as a home-grown coffee chain. There are more than 4,400 Tim Hortons locations worldwide, and about 3,700 of those are in Canada, where most of the allegations in the lawsuit have been made, though some of the claims apply to locations outside of the country.

Judy Watson watched as the California Poppy Reserve was established in the 1970s just five miles from her home. She was looking forward to cherishing its vistas forever. But today Watson is among area residents and nature lovers who fear that the state park's annual blaze of orange blossoms will be overshadowed by "green" — energy, that is, in the form of sprawling solar panels and gigantic industrial-size wind turbines. "The whole area will be changed forever," said Watson, 70, who lives in Kings Canyon at the base of verdant Portal Ridge.

Two cemeteries in Washington County are prime examples of the wealth of history that graveyards can hold -- and the need to preserve these sacred places for future generations. Located in the middle of the small town of Rice Lake, Wis., Oak Ridge Cemetery was established in 1882, the year the Great Northern Railroad came through the town. This cemetery contains the final resting places of many of the founding fathers of the village, as well as other prominent Rice Lake residents. As is true in so many older cemeteries, headstones tell the story of life as it was lived in a previous era.

May 23 - Egyptians arrive early at voting booth to cast their vote for the first president since deposed leader Hosni Mubarak. Rough cut (no reporter narration). ROUGH CUT, NO REPORTER NARRATION Security tightens around Cairo, as Egyptians gather to vote for their president. This will be the first time they are picking their president. The election is wide open, pitting Islamists against men who served under deposed leader Hosni Mubarak. The contest is a novelty for a nation where elections during the 30-year rule of a man some called "Pharaoh" were thinly attended rigmaroles in which the result was a foregone conclusion.

Newly anointed McDonald's CEO Donald Thompson gets some perks with his fries. McDonald’s Australia has apparently decided to auction off the first of 200 bottles of their “legendary” sauce on eBay and bidders are emptying more than just their pockets for a chance to purchase the limited-edition bottle. MANILA , Philippines — House Majority Leader Rolando Andaya Jr. will yield his position to Capiz 2nd District Rep. Fredenil Castro as part of a leadership shuffle in the 18th Congress. Andaya, 62, said his decision to step down is based on his plan to run again for congressman of Capiz’s first district. The House leader, who won reelection for the second consecutive term on May 13, is now serving the second of his two three-year consecutive terms. Andaya said, as a rule, a House member can only serve three consecutive terms.

One of the biggest highlights of Valve 's Greenlight process for games awaiting their arrival on Steam , is that it gives the Steam community a chance to choose what games get greenlit. One of the games that's been selected is PixelJam 's QWOP. Valve has also updated Steam to show the progress of Greenlight games and the status of the games as they move through Steam's internal pipeline. It's a nice little touch that will make it easier for Steam users to see what games are currently in development and coming to the service.

At least 21 people were killed and hundreds wounded in four days of fighting between two rival tribes in the southern Libyan town of Sebha. The clashes are between the Awled Suleiman tribe and the tribe of deposed leader Muammar Gaddafi, the Guedadfa tribe. The death toll is at 21 and about one hundred wounded from the Awled Suleiman tribe, according to the head of the Sebha Medical Center, Nasser al-Jehimi. The number of wounded victims on the part of the Guedadfa tribe is not known as they are being treated in another hospital.

Will an upcoming vote in Congress signal the end of Medicare? In the next few weeks Congress will decide whether to cut $54 billion in overpayments to Medicare insurers, igniting a battle that may well determine whether the program survives. On one side are Medicare supporters, who want it to continue as a successful social insurance program. On the other is the insurance industry, which is spending millions and lobbying hard to put Medicare on a fast track to privatization, a goal long sought by fiscal conservatives and their allies in right-wing think tanks.

Running errands on your bicycle is a great way to burn calories and get some exercise. When you need something small or you are just checking prices and availability, pedaling to the store can be a pleasant experience if you can find a bicycle-friendly route. Several major shopping locations in the Rogue Valley can be accessed by bicycles without encountering excessive traffic. For example, both the Rogue Valley Mall and the Medford Shopping Center are easily accessible from the Bear Creek Greenway bicycle path. It is somewhat more difficult to ride a bike to the big-box stores along Highway 62 (Crater Lake Highway).

Capital abundance , low interest rates , and high volatility are creating new challenges and opportunities in equity markets . In this article , we examine how these dynamics have shaped equity markets through history and what the future may hold. Capital abundance has a direct impact on equity valuations. The recent run-up in equity valuations has many observers wondering if valuations have gotten too high. Our analysis suggests that , in the short term , equities may have limited room to run in absolute terms. On the other hand , stocks appear cheap relative to other asset classes and to historical averages .

Teaching language to an artificial intelligence system is child ’ s play , thanks to MIT . Researchers at the school have found an approach that can train a model to speak and understand English sentences in a matter of weeks, rather than a matter of years. The new approach could help in the development of personal assistants and other devices that help people communicate through speech, the researchers say, as it allows the model to learn how to translate questions into coherent spoken statements. The AI system first learns to read sentences of written text and translate that text into phrases that it can understand.

The city is already looking at options to accommodate the more than 150 kids in pre-K, and more than 500 students in the high school after the first two buildings are completed. The city is also in the planning stages of a new elementary school for the East End of town.

SAN BERNARDINO – In recognition of his great aunt , San Bernardino Valley College art instructor David Rosales constructed an award-winning sculpture. “The idea for this piece came from my father,” said Rosales, 52. “My aunt had passed away but she had been a great inspiration for him and a very talented artist, as well. My dad always wanted a memorial in her honor. This is where it came in.”
A sculptor, Rosales has been teaching art for the past 20 years. His great aunt was a well-known Mexican artist who painted with oils as well as sculpting.

MARSHFIELD, Wis. — Joseph Calderaro, 67, is one of health care’s quiet success stories. Over the last four years, he has carefully managed his diabetes by lowering his blood sugar, blood pressure and cholesterol with diet, exercise and medication. To keep on track, Mr. Calderaro visits his doctor, attends meetings for diabetes patients and gets frequent calls from a health counselor. It is a team effort, orchestrated by the Marshfield Clinic here.

Planting the Savannah grasses in front of Cary Home seemed like a good idea in 2013 , when they received a grant of £800 from the National Trust, which they put towards the work. But they were wrong. Now, in 2018, they have had to have it replanted with more appropriate plant species, to try to save it from the ravages of a local herd of rabbits, who are determined to destroy it. “The grant money was spent on seeding the grass with a mix of seed, which we thought was appropriate. We were wrong about that.

The PS4 is launching with a versatile set of games today , but that doesn ’ t mean Sony wants to let the PlayStation 3 die off entirely. The PS4 will support the PlayStation 3′s remote play functionality, allowing users to stream games from their console to their PS4. However, Sony will require a paid PlayStation Plus account to play these games remotely, much as they did with the PS3 version. PlayStation Now, a streaming subscription service that is still only in beta and is only for select users , is also compatible with the PS4.

Sun, Dec 5, 2010 at 7:45 AM
On October 29, a cyclist was riding her bike in front of a Metro train at West Portal station when she was injured when the train hit her. She was taken to a local hospital, where she remains in critical but stable condition. The accident highlighted a larger question: should bicycles be allowed on Muni? Bicycles are currently allowed on Muni Metro trains.

The NSA spied on Israel despite a US pledge to curtail surveillance of ally states , revealing how the Israelis obtained a key phone number belonging to the head of a Palestinian militant group. The National Security Agency targeted the mobile phone of Jamal Abu Samhadana, the former commander of the Popular Resistance Committees, a Gaza group that killed five Israelis in 2000, according to the documents. The US agency then shared this intelligence with the CIA, according to a report on the agency's activities last year by the Washington Post, citing documents leaked by whistleblower Edward Snowden.

New York/London : Volatility returned to US markets , with stocks tumbling back toward a bear market after the biggest gain in nearly a decade on Tuesday. The Dow Jones Industrial Average plunged 310.90, or 3.6 per cent, to 8,224.94. The Standard and Poor's 500 index lost 38.99, or 4.3 per cent, to 859.29. In Europe, the FTSEurofirst index fell 2.9 per cent. The market volatility was also felt in Mumbai. The sensex dived over 700 points in the morning session of trade. It was the second-biggest fall this year.

Although state trademark registration offers fewer benefits than trademark registration with the United States Patent and Trademark Office, state trademark registration can be a cheap alternative for securing limited trademark rights. Federal trademark registration can run anywhere from several hundred dollars to $3,000, depending on the type of mark being registered and the amount of attorney's fees. On the other hand, many states charge less than $100 to file a trademark application. Keep in mind that state registration will not offer multi-state protection, nationwide priority status, incontestability, a presumption of validity or the ability to file a trademark on an intent to use basis.

PENTICTON , British Columbia -- Connor Hellebuyck does n't want to ruffle any feathers , but he 's not planning to back down, either. Sometimes, Hellebuyck believes, NHL goalies put too much importance on wins and losses. That 's especially true if a team 's record is not reflective of its actual performance. The Jets are in a good position to prove that this season. Hellebuyck, a 6-foot-4, 200-pound native of Commerce Township, Mich., posted 44 victories last season. That total is the second-highest in the NHL over the past three seasons, behind only Ben Bishop 's 45.

DUTA has been boycotting the evaluation for a month now to protest the new faculty reservation mechanism in universities and deemed institutions. On 25 July, JNU’s Delhi University Teacher Association (DUTA), the union of 3,800 JNU teachers and academics, decided to continue the boycott of faculty and teacher evaluation by the Delhi University Senate and syndicate, in a bid to protest against a new mechanism for faculty recruitment and reservation by the HRD Ministry. This mechanism, which was proposed in March, was passed on 5 July, in the form of an amendment to the UGC’s statute.

A cartographer that created maps for senior policy makers at the National Counterterrorism Center wants to map out your next hunt or backpacking trip. Ben Harshyne and his wife Kate Harshyne took a risk this year when Ben left his job as a contractor where he made maps for the National Counterterrorism Center and chose to work full time on a company he started called HUNTERRA Mapping. HUNTERRA creates maps by blending high-resolution aerial photography with a 3D-like terrain model. The company can create waterproof, tear resistant field maps, poster maps and custom-sized mega maps.

The Brother MFC-J775DW is a low-priced inkjet with very low running costs and a basic feature set for a home-office all-in-one printer. Low price. Very low running costs. TOPEKA ( AP ) - A bill that would rescind restrictions on the development of private property near historical sites has been passed by the Kansas Legislature. The Wichita Eagle reports that the House voted 92-28 on Thursday to send a Senate version of the measure that was amended Wednesday by the state Senate on a 31-8 vote. Rep. John Rubin, an Overland Park Republican, was the prime sponsor in the House of the bill, which was originally passed 111-15 on March 23. The bill will now go to Gov. Jeff Colyer, who has said he is generally supportive of the bill.

A local nonprofit whose mission is to transform the lives of at-risk youths will host its sixth annual fiesta fundraiser from 6 to 9 p.m. June 20 at the Mission Inn, 3649 Mission Inn Ave. The event, which benefits The Livingston Taylor Youth Focus Program, is a dinner and silent auction in support of the YEP program. YEP is a year-long, hands-on learning program for local high school students interested in learning to run a nonprofit organization. The students in the program create the fiesta event, raising money to fund the program and other Youth Focus programs.

The rapper could be heading to jail over child support again . ( AllHipHop News ) Chief Keef should be heading to jail again. The Chicago rapper was found to be in arrears by the state of Illinois and his child support case is back in court today. According to court documents obtained by TMZ, Child Support Services filed a petition against the “I Don’t Like” rapper for his failure to pay child support for his daughter in March. Chief Keef has been in and out of trouble with law enforcement and the courts for several years now.

French President Emmanuel Macron wants to invigorate the European Union as a global power and spurn the populist nationalism that threatens to undermine its success. But he knows it requires cooperation with the United States—which makes his strange bedfellow in the White House so crucial to his agenda. This piece originally appeared in the Washington Post. Macron, who at 40 is three decades younger than Trump, disdains the president’s abrasive nature and many of his policies, notably on Iran and climate change. The French president prefers books, ideas and lofty intellectual conversation to the aggressive transactional style embodied by Trump, who favors television over written text.

Sen. Cory Booker , the New Jersey Democrat who ’ s launched a bid for the White House in 2020, has long had his eye on a bigger prize than his Senate seat. As he begins a national tour this week, Booker is taking aim at the presidency. "I’ m going to work every day, not just to try to put myself in a position of running for the White House, I’ m going to run for president," Booker said during a "CBS This Morning" interview Friday. Booker’ s early campaign push comes as the Democratic presidential field grows larger every week.

The word hero gets thrown around so much that its use has lost much of the intended impact . Indie authors, however, are in the best place to use the word with authenticity and truth. Indies have created something out of nothing, and that is no small accomplishment. So how did these authors make their success? There are many factors but I want to point out three things that are very important. First, they wrote a good book. I know that is a given, but many books are not good enough to attract an audience. It is not just about the words.

Born in the country and fluent in the language, Gursewak Singh considers himself Japanese. The government doesn't. But it sometimes offers children like him a chance to stay - if their parents agree to leave. MATSUDO, Japan – Gursewak Singh composed his first letter to Japan’s justice minister when he was 10 years old. Almost seven years later, he is still writing. In all, he has written more than 50 letters. He has yet to get a reply. The letters, all written in Japanese, have become more eloquent as Gursewak has grown up.

Ryanair has lowered its full year profit guidance from a current range of €1.25-€1.35 billion to a new range of €1.10-€1.20 billion. The decision, which saw shares in the airline fall by more than ten per cent, comes after a turbulent period for the low-cost carrier. The Irish airline was recently hit by a fall in traffic after pilots and cabin crew in Germany, Holland, Belgium, Spain and Portugal went on strike. Ryanair has also been forced to lower fares for the third quarter of the year (particularly for the October school half-term holidays and Christmas) as customer confidence has been affected by fear of further strikes.

Steve Norris is former Conservative transport minister. Britain can reasonably claim to have invented the railway. Stephenson’s Rocket represented the pinnacle of British industrial-era innovation. The ability to move products and people by steam locomotion had a transformative effect on society. British ingenuity saw railways knit communities together across the country, and eventually the globe. And for the next couple of centuries, little changed. The same techniques are being used to maintain track now that were used in Stephenson’s time.

(CNN) — Portuguese sailors called it the "Gates of Hell." Namibia's Bushmen speak of the land God made in anger. From the air, the bleak shoreline of the Skeleton Coast looks wonderful -- a deep green sea, fringed with surf, breaks over a shore receding into infinite dunes. From land, it's a different story. The Benguela Current rushes in, urgent and strong, hurtling the chilling Atlantic into the fierce heat of the Namib. Whale and seal skeletons from the former whaling industry still litter the coastline -- the source of the region's frightening name.

Dan Rather on Trump: "It's never been this bad"
"We're better than this," journalist Dan Rather told Salon's Andrew O'Hehir on "Salon Talks," referring to President Donald Trump and the deep divisions in American politics today. The legendary investigative journalist and anchor has interviewed every president since Eisenhower and covered nearly every major political event in recent U.S. history: Watergate, President John F. Kennedy's assassination, 9/11, the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, the jailing of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. The list goes on.

Salad may be an overlooked part of the holiday meal , but it doesn ’ t have to be that way! In fact, it’s a great time to think outside the box and create an impressive, yet easy, holiday salad! To start off the festivities, I usually serve this easy and refreshing Citrus Salad. As the name indicates, it’s really simple to throw together – perfect for the host! I just slice a couple of oranges and clementines, toss them in a salad bowl with some romaine, then drizzle with a honey vinaigrette and a little sprinkle of chopped walnuts.
